question: Write a diary entry from the perspective of an Itzae reflecting on the similarity between Mayab and Hindostan and their shared language.
answer: Diary Entry â€” Lately, elders have spoken of the strange similarity between our land, Mayab, and distant Hindostan. Our Maya language is spoken in their valleys, and the stories we tell seem to share a common root. As I, an Itzae, see our people have retreated before the Nahualt, I wonder if our kin in Hindostan face the same fate or if our language will survive in either land.
